data.name: Self Portrait
data.description:
Oak-aged Belgian Tripel

The self portrait, to artists of all mediums, is a traditional exercise in self reflection. This exercise is used many times throughout an artist's career as a way of continually assessing where they have come from, how they have progressed, and where they are going. This process enables an artist to see their comfort zone in order to push beyond it. It is only fitting then that we brew our inaugural beer with a bit of self reflection in mind. We are taking this opportunity to brew a beer that exhibits our brewers' collective & diverse years of experience while at the same time exploring a beer style we haven't brewed often.

style.name: Belgian-Style Tripel
style.description: Tripels are often characterized by a complex, sometimes mild spicy character. Clove-like phenolic flavor and aroma may be evident at extremely low levels. Yeast-generated  fruity esters, including banana, are also common, but not necessary. These pale/light-colored ales may finish sweet, though any sweet finish should be light. The beer is characteristically medium and clean in body with an equalizing hop/malt balance and a perception of medium to medium high hop bitterness. Traditional Belgian Tripels are often well attenuated. Brewing sugar may be used to lighten the perception of body. Its sweetness will come from very pale malts. There should not be character from any roasted or dark malts. Low hop flavor is acceptable. Alcohol strength and flavor should be perceived as evident. Head retention is dense and mousse-like. Chill haze is acceptable at low serving temperatures. Traditional Tripels are bottle conditioned, may exhibit slight yeast haze but the yeast should not be intentionally roused. Oxidative character if evident in aged Tripels should be mild and pleasant.

breweries.name: Rexx Reserve
breweries.description: Is somewhat of an open-ended project. Our brewers, George, Bob, & Eric come from diverse brewing backgrounds which we believe, despite butting heads occasionally, is a great strength to be harnessed. Rather than setting forth a staunch regiment of a certain style of beer, we want Rexx to grow and progress organically. The artist Robert Motherwell once said "A subject emerges from an interaction between my self, my I, and my medium." This is the same process we employ in the creation of our beers. Each beer is born out of a free flowing of ideas; a collaborative exchange of concepts between intellectual thesis and recipe. This then leads to lots of pilot brewing which often leads to further discussion of concept until ultimately either the beer style is determined by the concept or vice versa. This process allows for a great amount of freedom and creativity to already be present at the beginning of every new project.

data.name: Self Reliance #1
data.description: American Pale Ale brewed with Nelson and Motueka hops.

style.name: American-Style Pale Ale
style.description: American pale ales range from deep golden to copper in color. The style is characterized by fruity, floral and citrus-like American-variety hop character producing medium to medium-high hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma. Note that the "traditional" style of this beer has its origins with certain floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American hop varietals. One or more of these hop characters is the perceived end, but the perceived hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. American pale ales have medium body and low to medium maltiness. Low caramel character is allowable. Fruity-ester flavor and aroma should be moderate to strong. Diacetyl should be absent or present at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Hill Farmstead Brewery
breweries.description: Hill Farmstead Brewery is the culmination of travel and insight, of friendships and explorations, and of realizing a sense of one’s place.  Upon the hand hewn land of our forebears, we honor eight generations of Greensboro ancestry by thoughtfully engaging with our heritage and with our distinctive beers. This offering is our effort to revive, diversify, and prolong the memory of the Hill Farmstead. Share. Consider. Enjoy.

American brown ales have evident low to medium hop flavor and aroma, medium to high hop bitterness, and a medium body. Estery and fruity-ester characters should be subdued. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Stillwater Artisanal Ales
breweries.description:
"A sincere artist is not one who makes a faithful attempt to put on to canvas what is in front of him, but one who tries to create something which is, in itself, a living thing." -Sir William Dobell

The goal of Stillwater Artisanal is just that, living art. Although packaged within a medium often overlooked for its artistic merits, our desire is to offer something new and intriguing. We present more than just a fine crafted beverage, rather an occasion that evokes an emotion and inspires contemplation. For art is not a sum of actions but rather an approach to life. We draw our inspiration from the world around us, whether that be a season, location, or even humanity itself. Our intent is to encapsulate this muse exhibiting an artistic rendition to the best of our abilities.

data.name: Selfies Are For Wieners Double IPA With Honey
data.nameDisplay: Selfies Are For Wieners Double IPA With Honey
data.description:
Don't fight it, Spite It!

We see you on the Internet, pixelated and hungry for attention.

You just posted a selfie, and can't wait for the validation.

"Beautiful."

"HOTT."

"SEXY."

But not this time.

This selfie is going to cost you a punch in the nuts and a loss of self-worth.

We discovered that our honey IPA is a natural duck face repellent.

Citric and dry, with a delightful addition of honey.

Redeem yourself, wiener.

Following our four easy steps in the only known cure for the selfie pandemic.

style.name: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale
style.description: Imperial or Double India Pale Ales have intense hop bitterness, flavor and aroma. Alcohol content is medium-high to high and notably evident. They range from deep golden to medium copper in color. The style may use any variety of hops. Though the hop character is intense it's balanced with complex alcohol flavors, moderate to high fruity esters and medium to high malt character. Hop character should be fresh and lively and should not be harsh in quality. The use of large amounts of hops may cause a degree of appropriate hop haze. Imperial or Double India Pale Ales have medium-high to full body. Diacetyl should not be perceived. The intention of this style of beer is to exhibit the fresh and bright character of hops. Oxidative character and aged character should not be present.

style.name: American-Style India Pale Ale
style.description: American-style India pale ales are perceived to have medium-high to intense hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content. The style is further characterized by floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American-variety hop character. Note that one or more of these American-variety hop characters is the perceived end, but the hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. The use of water with high mineral content results in a crisp, dry beer. This pale gold to deep copper-colored ale has a full, flowery hop aroma and may have a strong hop flavor (in addition to the perception of hop bitterness). India pale ales possess medium maltiness which contributes to a medium body. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to very strong. Diacetyl can be absent or may be perceived at very low levels. Chill and/or hop haze is allowable at cold temperatures. (English and citrus-like American hops are considered enough of a distinction justifying separate American-style IPA and English-style IPA categories or subcategories. Hops of other origins may be used for bitterness or approximating traditional American or English character. See English-style India Pale Ale

breweries.name: Beaver Island Brewery
breweries.description: At one time, St. Cloud was the home of six local breweries, but with the closing of the last one in 1939, local brewing became a thing of the past. Until now. Nick Barth and Matt Studer, two avid homebrewers and passionate entrepreneurs, have teamed up with local professional brewmaster Chris Laumb to launch Beaver Island Brewing Company—a venture that will revive the rich tradition of brewing in St. Cloud.

style.name: Irish-Style Red Ale
style.description: Irish-style red ales range from light red-amber-copper to light brown in color. These ales have a medium hop bitterness and flavor. They often don't have hop aroma. Irish-style red ales have low to medium candy-like caramel malt sweetness and may have a balanced subtle degree of roast barley or roast malt character and complexity.  Irish-style Red Ales have a medium body. The style may have low levels of fruity-ester flavor and aroma. Diacetyl should be absent or at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Slight yeast haze is acceptable for bottle-conditioned products.

breweries.name: Portsmouth Brewery
breweries.description:
The Portsmouth Brewery, New Hampshire's first brewpub, was founded in 1991, four years after its sister company, the Northampton Brewery, opened in Western Massachusetts. Peter Egelston, Head Brewer in Northampton from 1987 until 1991, moved to Portsmouth to set up the new brewery here. (Egelston is now the sole proprietor of the Brewery.) 

The brewing system consists of a custom made seven-barrel (210 gallons) JV Northwest brewhouse, two fourteen-barrel and three seven-barrel JV Northwest unitank (cylindroconical) fermenters, two fourteen-barrel horizontal fermenters (added later, in 1994), and twelve seven-barrel grundy cellar tanks. Originally, the Portsmouth Brewery opened with beer recipes from Northampton - Pale Ale, Old Brown Dog, Weizenheimer, Black Cat Stout, Blonde Ale, Golden and Amber Lagers - and these still comprise the core of the Brewery's full-time beers today. However, over the years, successive brewers have contributed many outstanding seasonal and specialty beers to the list.  All of the beers served at the Portsmouth Brewery are brewed right here on premise, with the exception of those beers, such as Shoals Pale Ale and Portsmouth Lager, brewed at Smuttynose Brewing Company, our sister company.

style.name: Belgian-Style Pale Ale
style.description: Belgian-style pale ales are characterized by low but noticeable hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma. Light to medium body and low malt aroma are typical. They are light amber to deep amber in color. Noble-type hops are commonly used. Low to medium fruity esters are evident in aroma and flavor. Low levels of phenolic spiciness from yeast byproducts may be perceived. Low caramel or toasted malt flavor is okay. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Barley Mow Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The BMBC is a nanobrewery and tavern in downtown Largo, FL. For all the non-Floridians out there, Largo is located in Pinellas County just north of St Petersburg. We have a 2 BBL system, which means we're able to produce about 4 kegs at a time. We started out with 3-80 gallon fermenters and have already added a 4th, 3 BBL fermenter!
Our tavern has 14 constantly rotating taps. We try to keep a many of our own beers on tap at all times, when we can't fill them, the rest are reserved for only American brews, most of which are Florida born. We also have an awesome wine list.

style.name: Pumpkin Beer
style.description: Pumpkin beers are any beers using pumpkins (Cucurbito pepo) as an adjunct in either mash, kettle, primary or secondary fermentation, providing obvious (ranging from subtle to intense), yet harmonious, qualities. Pumpkin qualities should not be overpowered by hop character. These may or may not be spiced or flavored with other things. A statement by the brewer explaining the nature of the beer is essential for fair assessment in competitions. If this beer is a classic style with pumpkin, the brewer should also specify the classic style.

breweries.name: Ei8ht Ball Brewing
breweries.description:
Ei8ht Ball, named after the streets we got our
credit from, we are humble yet proud. Local but not
influenced. We might not move mountains, but we will
push the envelope. We will test theories and create
moments through our liquid in which tones and times
are our muse. We will brew and flow with poise and
confidence. We will rush for no one, yet hesitate for
nothing. We strive to please but make no apologies. No
billboards, neon lights and flashy text, it’s not our speed.
Make us part of your flight or enjoy us with a meal and
the mission is complete. For all of those in search of
something diverse, unique, improved and fresh, look
into, behind, under and around the Ei8ht Ball. What you
will find is what you never thought you were looking for.
This is Ei8ht Ball Brewing, the proof is the glass.

style.name: Extra Special Bitter
style.description: Extra special bitter possesses medium to strong hop aroma, flavor, and bitterness. The residual malt and defining sweetness of this richly flavored, full-bodied bitter is more pronounced than in other styles of bitter. It is light amber to copper colored with medium to medium-high bitterness. Mild carbonation traditionally characterizes draft-cask versions, but in bottled versions, a slight increase in carbon dioxide content is acceptable. Fruity-ester character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Diacetyl (butterscotch character) is acceptable and characteristic when at very low levels. The absence of diacetyl is also acceptable. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. English or American hops may be used. (English and American hop character may be specified in subcategories.)

breweries.name: 13 Virtues Brewing Co
breweries.description:
We are a three-barrel brew house born from the shadows of long tenured Portland restaurant, Philadelphia’s Steaks & Hoagies. The brewery addition was added back in 1994 but operated quietly as Oregon’s smallest micobrewery for many years. With the more recent additions of David Vohden and Cameron Moore, we have refocused our efforts on producing and sharing a constantly changing lineup of fresh quality beers from right here in the Great Pacific Northwest. Vohden oversees all brewery operations which he has met with great success. Most recently of which was a Silver Medal for our Woozy Weizenbock at the Great American Beer Festival. We see our recent efforts bringing exciting results.

We reached completion of a 3,500 sq ft. addition to expand our brew house in the Summer of 2013. Vohden and Moore finished installation of the glycol system just in time to quench the thirsty demands of the 2013 Oregon Brewers Festival with a crowd pleasing Traverse Cherry Wit Bier. In addition to the brew house expansion we have added four 7-barrel fermentation tanks for an eventual all around 7-barrel system upgrade. A Cellar was also added for barrel aging, sours, and other delectable experiments.

Although most of the square footage was utilized for brewing purposes. We were sure to save some space for all you beer drinkers. A mezzanine gives an elevated view down onto the open brewery floor. If you happen to drop by on a brew day you too can enjoy the sweet sensory overload and watch the action (or lack thereof). A beautiful black walnut bar, fully stocked with 13 drafts faucets was added to accompany the additional seating area and to cater to private events. However, the new bar and brewery seating are always open to patrons except in the case of private events. Another 60′ TV was added to the new mezzanine area and we continue to play all major sporting events. Go Blazers!

Some would say our legendary steak sandwiches and two dozen rotating taps are a match made in heaven. Please join us and stop by to see what’s new!

style.name: Specialty Beer
style.description: These beers are brewed using unusual fermentable sugars, grains and starches that contribute to alcohol content other than, or in addition to, malted barley. Nuts generally have some degree of fermentables, thus beers brewed with nuts would appropriately be entered in this category. The distinctive characters of these special ingredients should be evident either in the aroma, flavor or overall balance of the beer, but not necessarily in overpowering quantities. For example, maple syrup or potatoes would be considered unusual. Rice, corn, or wheat are not considered unusual. Special ingredients must be listed when competing. A statement by the brewer explaining the special nature of the beer, ingredient(s) and achieved character is essential in order for fair assessment in competitions. If this beer is a classic style with some specialty ingredient(s), the brewer should also specify the classic style. Guidelines for competing: Spiced beers using unusual fermentables should be entered in the experimental category. Fruit beers using unusual fermentables should be entered in the fruit beer category.

From his flagship Tailgater Kölsch, an authentic German Style Ale, to his creative and eclectic barrel aged brews, this 25 year old wiz kid is taking Oregon by storm.  In Aug 2013, Flat Tail installed a brand new 15 barrel system and will be available all over Oregon and many more locations very soon.  Try some Dam Good Beer today!

data.description: Welcome to the new world order. Our new Project stretches the limit of our brewing prowess. Crafted to be low calorie and gluten reduced this canvas showcases bright black cherry notes. Finishes light, crisp, and effervescent.

style.name: Specialty Beer
style.description: These beers are brewed using unusual fermentable sugars, grains and starches that contribute to alcohol content other than, or in addition to, malted barley. Nuts generally have some degree of fermentables, thus beers brewed with nuts would appropriately be entered in this category. The distinctive characters of these special ingredients should be evident either in the aroma, flavor or overall balance of the beer, but not necessarily in overpowering quantities. For example, maple syrup or potatoes would be considered unusual. Rice, corn, or wheat are not considered unusual. Special ingredients must be listed when competing. A statement by the brewer explaining the special nature of the beer, ingredient(s) and achieved character is essential in order for fair assessment in competitions. If this beer is a classic style with some specialty ingredient(s), the brewer should also specify the classic style. Guidelines for competing: Spiced beers using unusual fermentables should be entered in the experimental category. Fruit beers using unusual fermentables should be entered in the fruit beer category.

breweries.name: Platform Beer Co.
breweries.description:
Platform was founded in 2014 on the premise that collaboration should be at the cornerstone of everything that we do. Whether it be with pro brewers, the home brewing world or a variety of other industries, beer is special and should be shared.
From humble beginnings, brewing on a 3 bbl brewhouse in Cleveland, Platform has expanded to a second Tasting Room in Columbus, a Production Facility in Cleveland, a Cincinnati Tasting Room named LOCOBA and a Sour Beer Facility named Phunkenship

We brew high-quality craft beers for sale in our tasting rooms and distribute throughout  Ohio. Expect a mix of ever-changing styles inspired by beer trends.

style.name: Wood- and Barrel-Aged Dark Beer
style.description: Any classic style or unique experimental style of dark beer can be wood or barrel-aged for a period of time in a wooden barrel or in contact with wood. This beer is aged with the intention of imparting the particularly unique character of the wood and/or what has previously been in the barrel. New wood character can be characterized as a complex blend of vanillin and/or other unique wood character but wood-aged is not necessarily synonymous with imparting wood-flavors. Used sherry, rum, bourbon, scotch, port, wine and other barrels are often used, imparting complexity and uniqueness to beer. Ultimately a balance of flavor, aroma and mouthfeel are sought with the marriage of new beer with wood and/or barrel flavors. Primary character of the beer style may or may not be apparent. Sour wood-aged beer of any color is outlined in other categories. Dark fruited or spiced beer would also be appropriately entered in this category. Beers in this style may or may not have Brettanomyces character.  The brewer should explain the special nature of the beer to allow for accurate judging. Comments could include: type of wood used (new or old, oak or other wood type), type of barrel used (new, port/ whiskey/ wine/ sherry/ other), base beer style or achieved character. Beer entries not accompanied by this information will be at a disadvantage during judging.

breweries.name: Moon Dog Craft Brewery
breweries.description:
The Moon Dog brewery is as hand-crafted as the delicious beer it produces. A good chunk of the brewing gear was cobbled together from second-hand farming and dairy equipment.

The brewhouse is a four vessel 13hL electric system (hot liquor, mash/lauter kettle and whirlpool). The beautiful and shiny fermentation system is comprised of an ever-growing farm of cylindro-conical tanks.

There is a wall of barrels, a painting of "The Big Man" - John Candy, many many chandeliers, a pink elephant (actually, maybe a few..), and most of all a whole lota love.

It has been described by one observer as the “oddest brewery” he's ever seen. We like to call it home.

style.name: French & Belgian-Style Saison
style.description: Beers in this category are golden to deep amber in color. There may be quite a variety of characters within this style. Generally: They are light to medium in body. Malt aroma is low to medium-low. Esters are medium to high in  aroma, while, complex alcohols, herbs, spices, low Brettanomyces character and even clove and smoke-like phenolics may or may not be evident in the overall balanced beer. Hop aroma and flavor may be at low to medium levels. Malt flavor is low but provides foundation for the overall balance. Hop bitterness is moderate to moderately assertive. Herb and/or spice flavors, including black pepper-like notes, may or may not be evident. Fruitiness from fermentation is generally in character. A balanced small amount of sour or acidic flavors is acceptable when in balance with other components. Earthy, cellar-like, musty aromas are okay. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill or slight yeast haze is okay. Often bottle conditioned with some yeast character and high carbonation. French & Belgian-Style Saison may have Brettanomyces characters that are slightly acidity, fruity, horsey, goaty and/or leather-like.

data.name: Seme Della Vita
data.description: Belgian-style tripel brewed with pistachios and vanilla beans

style.name: Belgian-Style Tripel
style.description: Tripels are often characterized by a complex, sometimes mild spicy character. Clove-like phenolic flavor and aroma may be evident at extremely low levels. Yeast-generated  fruity esters, including banana, are also common, but not necessary. These pale/light-colored ales may finish sweet, though any sweet finish should be light. The beer is characteristically medium and clean in body with an equalizing hop/malt balance and a perception of medium to medium high hop bitterness. Traditional Belgian Tripels are often well attenuated. Brewing sugar may be used to lighten the perception of body. Its sweetness will come from very pale malts. There should not be character from any roasted or dark malts. Low hop flavor is acceptable. Alcohol strength and flavor should be perceived as evident. Head retention is dense and mousse-like. Chill haze is acceptable at low serving temperatures. Traditional Tripels are bottle conditioned, may exhibit slight yeast haze but the yeast should not be intentionally roused. Oxidative character if evident in aged Tripels should be mild and pleasant.

style.name: Historical Beer
style.description: Historical Beers are any range of color. Malt sweetness will vary dramatically depending on overall balance desired. Hop bitterness is very low to very high. Above all beers in this category are reflective of an established historical beer and/or brewing heritage from any period of time or part of the world, that are not already a beer style already established in these guidelines. This beer commemorates combinations of unique brewing ingredients and/or techniques established in past periods. Examples of Historical Beers might include current day versions of historic styles which are not represented elsewhere in these guidelines, such as Finnish-style Sahti, South American Chicha, Nepalese Chong/Chang, African sorghum based beers, and others. In evaluating these beers, judges will weigh several factors such as uniqueness, heritage, regional distinction, technical brewing skills, and balance of character, background story & information and overall spirit of the intent of this category. "Historical beers" that are not represented elsewhere as a definitive style in these guidelines could possibly be entered in such categories as Experimental, Herb & Spice, Field Beer, etc. but by choice a brewer may categorize (and enter) their beer as Historical beer.

data.name: Semedorato Lager Beer
data.description:
Low-fermented, light-coloured premium beer made from pure barley malt. An elegant and refined beer with an alcohol content of 5% and served at a temperature of 5-6°C.
Sicily recipe. Lager beer. Premium lager beer of pure barley malt. Beer of pure barley malt, 5° degrees. Silver medal at US beer tasting (July 2018) with 87/100 points. Winner ad "Cerevisia Award" 2015 in Italy, Perugia: Best lager beer of south Italy and islands. Beer of straw color, with white foam, fine and persistent. At nose dominate notes of malt, vanilla, cereal, floral. In mouth very balanced, with hints of malt and vanilla
data.foodPairings: A well balanced and refreshing lager. Beer for every meal and occasion, has been defined the best beer to accompany pizza, hot dogs, sandwiches, fried chicken, turkey burger, pork kebabs, brie.

style.name: American-Style Premium Lager
style.description: This style has low malt (and adjunct) sweetness, is medium bodied, and should contain no or a low percentage (less than 25%) of adjuncts. Color may be light straw to golden. Alcohol content and bitterness may also be greater. Hop aroma and flavor is low or negligible. Light fruity esters are acceptable. Chill haze and diacetyl should be absent. Note: Some beers marketed as "premium" (based on price) may not fit this definition.

breweries.name: Semedorato
breweries.description:
Semedorato beer was founded in Sommatino (Caltanissetta) in 2014. The company is distributed over an area of about 25,000 square meters, of which 1000 square meters are all indoor, these are divided into 600 square meters used for the production plant and 400 square meters for offices, while over 1500 square meters of warehouses are used for the storage of finished products and raw materials.

Birra Semedorato premium lager beer of pure barley malt with 5° alcohol content. It is positioned on the market offering a fair competitiveness in the premium segment and providing a unique personality, distinguishing itself from competitors with a full-bodied flavor, fruity and aromatic, attractive packaging and a name different from the usual, absolutely original and with character. Semedorato Beer is addressed in particular to the educated, exigent and evolved consumer.

Golden Seed, a 7-degree double malt red beer.
It is addressed to the most demanding consumer and in keeping with the times, in addition to the classic connoisseurs passionate about special beers with a strong personality. 

The beers 1st prize won (Cerevisia competition organized by Banco Nazionale delle Birre, Assobirra, University of Perugia) Semedorato beer after a few months from the beginning of its activity, in 2015, as the best lager beer in southern Italy and the Italian Islands.
1st prize won at the World Beer Awards in London (August 2017) with Golden Seed red as the best Italian bock beer in the world.

data.name: Semi Skimmed Occultist
data.description:
Our first small-batch canned release of 2017 is hot off the press and looks an absolute picture thanks to the amazing custom can artwork from the incredible guys at The Red Dress. We wanted to produce something of true decadence, so have packed into the recipe everything that we could think of to raise the body and make a smooth, truly redolent deep stout.

The four key additions exaggerate the mouthfeel and work with the blend of malts, oats and wheat to leave you with a beer that is best enjoyed on those dark, early-spring evenings when the weather is yet to break and the cold still seeps in around the door jambs. The result? In a word, opulence. The aromas start with cocoa and vanilla but it is the flavour that really holds the key to our latest small-batch release. Chocolate milkshake, roasty espresso and mellow vanilla blend into one in a smooth, full-bodied beer that is rich, deep and rewarding.

This is a full bodied beer. Ale-like fruity esters should be evident but not overpowering and compliment malt derived sweetness and hop character. Hop flavor and aroma may vary from being low to medium-high. Diacetyl (butterscotch) levels should be absent.

breweries.name: Shacksbury Cider
breweries.description:
Far from ordinary, apples are the most diverse food plant on earth. Unfortunately, only a handful of varieties are cultivated at scale in America, and all of those are designed for eating, not cider making.

At Shacksbury, we believe cider can, and should, be daring and complex. From gnarled trees on New England farmsteads to Old World orchards in England and Spain, our cider will change the way you think about this amazing fruit.

style.name: Dry Mead
style.description: Similar in balance, body, finish and flavor intensity to a dry white wine, with a pleasant mixture of subtle honey character, soft fruity esters, and clean alcohol. Complexity, harmony, and balance of sensory elements are most desirable, with no inconsistencies in color, aroma, flavor or aftertaste. The proper balance of sweetness, acidity, alcohol and honey character is the essential final measure of any mead.

breweries.name: New Day Craft Mead & Cider
breweries.description:
Focused on modern craft mead and hard cider, New Day Craft has been producing innovative, palate pleasing beverages since 2006.  Our beverages are bold and full of flavor, with a complexity found by virtue of using whole fruit and wildflower honey.
NO concentrates, purees or natural flavors used here.
Having built our brand through commitment to creating quality, well balanced products, we enjoy an excellent reputation with our products actively sought after by mead, cider and beer drinkers from all over. 
Headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana, you can visit our tasting room in Historic Fountain Square, if you're in the neighborhood, or pick up a glass or bottle at your favorite bar or package store.  Ever pushing boundaries, we are growing our distribution beyond Indiana's borders, so be on the lookout as New Day Craft comes to your neighborhood!

style.name: American-Style India Pale Ale
style.description: American-style India pale ales are perceived to have medium-high to intense hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content. The style is further characterized by floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American-variety hop character. Note that one or more of these American-variety hop characters is the perceived end, but the hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. The use of water with high mineral content results in a crisp, dry beer. This pale gold to deep copper-colored ale has a full, flowery hop aroma and may have a strong hop flavor (in addition to the perception of hop bitterness). India pale ales possess medium maltiness which contributes to a medium body. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to very strong. Diacetyl can be absent or may be perceived at very low levels. Chill and/or hop haze is allowable at cold temperatures. (English and citrus-like American hops are considered enough of a distinction justifying separate American-style IPA and English-style IPA categories or subcategories. Hops of other origins may be used for bitterness or approximating traditional American or English character. See English-style India Pale Ale

style.name: Oatmeal Stout
style.description: Oatmeal stouts include oatmeal in their grist, resulting in a pleasant, full flavor and a smooth profile that is rich without being grainy. A roasted malt character which is caramel-like and chocolate-like should be evident - smooth and not bitter. Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas (chocolate and nut-like) are prominent. Color is dark brown to black. Bitterness is moderate, not high. Hop flavor and aroma are optional but should not overpower the overall balance if present. This is a medium- to full- bodied beer, with minimal fruity esters. Diacetyl should be absent or at extremely low levels. Original gravity range and alcohol levels are indicative of English tradition of oatmeal stout.

breweries.name: Kuhnhenn Brewing
breweries.description:
Founded in 1998, Kuhnhenn Brewing Company began as a homebrew supplies shop in the family's former hardware store while buildout on the brewery was taking place. 

The company has been producing countless award-winning beer, mead, and wine out of their 8-barrel brewery since 2001. In 2012, Kuhnhenn took home the Gold Medal at the World Beer Cup in the IPA category for their flagship offering, DRIPA, or Double Rice IPA.

The brewery  has expanded to capacity over the years, with only limited distribution in Michigan, New York City, and parts of Europe, in addition to taking part in festivals throughout the world. Construction is underway on a production brewery and second taproom in nearby Clinton Township, which will allow the brewery to get closer to meeting demand by increasing capacity more than 1500% overnight. 

Visit the brewery taproom for to-go sales of some of their award-winning products.

The proper balance of sweetness, acidity, alcohol and honey character is the essential final measure of any mead.

breweries.name: New Day Craft Mead & Cider
breweries.description:
Focused on modern craft mead and hard cider, New Day Craft has been producing innovative, palate pleasing beverages since 2006.  Our beverages are bold and full of flavor, with a complexity found by virtue of using whole fruit and wildflower honey.
NO concentrates, purees or natural flavors used here.
Having built our brand through commitment to creating quality, well balanced products, we enjoy an excellent reputation with our products actively sought after by mead, cider and beer drinkers from all over. 
Headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana, you can visit our tasting room in Historic Fountain Square, if you're in the neighborhood, or pick up a glass or bottle at your favorite bar or package store.  Ever pushing boundaries, we are growing our distribution beyond Indiana's borders, so be on the lookout as New Day Craft comes to your neighborhood!

style.name: Other Fruit Melomel
style.description: In well-made examples of the style, the fruit is both distinctive and well-incorporated into the honey-sweet-acid-tannin-alcohol balance of the mead. Different types of fruit can result in widely different characteristics; allow for a variation in the final product.

breweries.name: Kuhnhenn Brewing
breweries.description:
Founded in 1998, Kuhnhenn Brewing Company began as a homebrew supplies shop in the family's former hardware store while buildout on the brewery was taking place. 

The company has been producing countless award-winning beer, mead, and wine out of their 8-barrel brewery since 2001. In 2012, Kuhnhenn took home the Gold Medal at the World Beer Cup in the IPA category for their flagship offering, DRIPA, or Double Rice IPA.

The brewery  has expanded to capacity over the years, with only limited distribution in Michigan, New York City, and parts of Europe, in addition to taking part in festivals throughout the world. Construction is underway on a production brewery and second taproom in nearby Clinton Township, which will allow the brewery to get closer to meeting demand by increasing capacity more than 1500% overnight. 

Visit the brewery taproom for to-go sales of some of their award-winning products.

style.description: Like a dry wine with complex flavors. The apple character must marry with the added fruit so that neither dominates the other.

breweries.name: Blue Mountain Cider Company
breweries.description:
We are the Blue Mountain Cider families, proudly carrying on the agricultural traditions put in place decades ago by the Earl Brown family. Those traditions include best practices for the environment and giving customers our fullest attention.

Our hard ciders, while huge with flavor, contain less alcohol than wine and are less filling than beer. We use only apples grown in the renowned Walla Walla Valley, many from Earl Brown Family orchards.

Blue Mountain Cider is one of the few cideries that adds back fresh juice prior to bottling along with a dash of carbonation, helping to maintain qualities that makes our beverage unique and delicious.

When well made, hard cider is a refreshing beverage with wide appeal. We pride ourselves on offering several varieties — sweet, dry and more — to tempt every palate.

style.name: Semi-Sweet Mead
style.description: Similar in balance, body, finish and flavor intensity to a semisweet (or medium-dry) white wine, with a pleasant mixture of honey character, light sweetness, soft fruity esters, and clean alcohol. Complexity, harmony, and balance of sensory elements are most desirable, with no inconsistencies in color, aroma, flavor or aftertaste. The proper balance of sweetness, acidity, alcohol and honey character is the essential final measure of any mead.

data.name: Semi-sweet Plum Honey Wine
data.description: Our Semi-Sweet Plum Honey Wine is a sweet blush wine, full of rich notes of cinnamon, dried fig and honey. This fine sweet blush wine shows a light amber color, with a lovely sweet-spice aroma. It opens onto the palate with heady notes of cinnamon and mace, flowing into a complex mixture of dried fig, raisin and Bing cherry, and ending in a rich honey finish. It is amazing just how complex a wine the combination of tree-ripened plums and wildflower honey can create! Pair this complex blush wine with a plate of aged goat cheeses and fresh figs, or along side sashimi and a bowl of natto.

style.name: American-Style India Pale Ale
style.description: American-style India pale ales are perceived to have medium-high to intense hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content. The style is further characterized by floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American-variety hop character. Note that one or more of these American-variety hop characters is the perceived end, but the hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. The use of water with high mineral content results in a crisp, dry beer. This pale gold to deep copper-colored ale has a full, flowery hop aroma and may have a strong hop flavor (in addition to the perception of hop bitterness). India pale ales possess medium maltiness which contributes to a medium body. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to very strong. Diacetyl can be absent or may be perceived at very low levels. Chill and/or hop haze is allowable at cold temperatures. (English and citrus-like American hops are considered enough of a distinction justifying separate American-style IPA and English-style IPA categories or subcategories. Hops of other origins may be used for bitterness or approximating traditional American or English character. See English-style India Pale Ale

style.name: American-Style Amber/Red Ale
style.description: American amber/red ales range from light copper to light brown in color. They are characterized by American-variety hops used to produce the perception of medium hop bitterness, flavor, and medium aroma. Amber ales have medium-high to high maltiness with medium to low caramel character. They should have medium to medium-high body. The style may have low levels of fruityester flavor and aroma. Diacetyl can be either absent or barely perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Slight yeast haze is acceptable for bottle-conditioned products.

hops.name: Cascade
hops.description: Cascade was created in the United States as an open-pollinated cross between Fuggle and Serebrianker. Its instantly recognizable grapefruit, floral aroma is characteristic of many American ales. Cascade is also one of the easiest hop varieties to grow; it can grow well under less than ideal conditions or in short growing seasons, and unlike most varieties, if started from a good rhizome a Cascade can produce a good crop even in its first growing season.

hops.name: Nugget
hops.description: A strong bittering hop derived from Brewer's Gold, with contributions from Early Green, East Kent Golding, and others. Primarily used for bittering, it has a smooth but somewhat heavy, herbal, spicy bitterness. Some feel that its distinctive flavor and aroma characteristics give it potential as an aroma hop as well.
